articles.headline: Pastor Urges His Flock to Bring Guns to Church
articles.snippet: In Louisville, Ky., a sign that American gun culture is thriving despite, or perhaps because of, President Obama.
articles.abstract: In Louisville, Ky., a sign that American gun culture is thriving despite, or perhaps because of, President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Ken Pagano, the pastor of the New Bethel Church here, is passionate about gun rights. He shoots regularly at the local firing range, and his sermon two weeks ago was on “God, Guns, Gospel and Geometry.” And on Saturday night, he is inviting his congregation of 150 and others to wear or carry their firearms into the sanctuary to “celebrate our rights as Americans!” as a promotional flier for the “open carry celebration” puts it.

articles.headline: Derivatives Tug of War Takes Shape
articles.snippet: The derivatives industry has started a public relations campaign arguing that it is helpful to businesses.
articles.abstract: The derivatives industry has started a public relations campaign arguing that it is helpful to businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the world of derivatives, profits for the dealers come from complexity and secrecy.

articles.headline: As Plants Close, Teenagers Focus More on College
articles.snippet: Teenagers in suburban Dayton, Ohio, are heading to community colleges after manufacturing plants closed.
articles.abstract: Teenagers in suburban Dayton, Ohio, are heading to community colleges after manufacturing plants closed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST CARROLLTON, Ohio  In the tight-knit, middle-class communities surrounding Dayton, many members of the class of ’09 knew exactly what they would do when they grew up.

articles.headline: Game Changer in Retailing, Bar Code Is 35
articles.snippet: The black and white bars designed in the 1970s to read prices and track inventory are now scanned more than 10 billion times a day.
articles.abstract: The black and white bars designed in the 1970s to read prices and track inventory are now scanned more than 10 billion times a day.
articles.lead_paragraph: The design was straightforward  59 black and white bars. And the inventors’ objectives were simple enough, too  to speed up the grocery checkout line and give supermarkets a new tool to track their stock.

articles.headline: Obama and Congress Clash on How to Pay for Health Care
articles.snippet: The president is unwilling to deepen the deficit, but House and Senate leaders do not like his proposals or one another’s.
articles.abstract: The president is unwilling to deepen the deficit, but House and Senate leaders do not like his proposals or one another’s.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  It has become the trillion-dollar question: can President Obama find that much in spending cuts and tax increases to keep his campaign promise to overhaul the health care system, without adding to already huge deficits? Mr. Obama and the Democrats running Congress are deeply split over the possibilities.

articles.headline: Premier Casting U.S. Withdrawal as Iraq Victory
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki is hailing the pullout of American forces from Iraqi cities, but the risk of renewed insurgent violence remains.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki is hailing the pullout of American forces from Iraqi cities, but the risk of renewed insurgent violence remains.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki has taken to calling the withdrawal of American combat troops from Iraq’s cities by next Tuesday a “great victory,” a repulsion of foreign occupiers he compares to the rebellion against British troops in 1920.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Marc Santora

articles.headline: Justices Rule Lab Analysts Must Testify on Results
articles.snippet: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the Supreme Court said analysts must testify when scientific evidence is used in criminal cases.
articles.abstract: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the Supreme Court said analysts must testify when scientific evidence is used in criminal cases.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Crime laboratory reports may not be used against criminal defendants at trial unless the analysts responsible for creating them give testimony and subject themselves to cross-examination, the Supreme Court ruled Thursday in a 5-to-4 decision.

articles.headline: Iranian Leaders Gaining the Edge Over Protesters
articles.snippet: Options continued to shrink for the opposition as Iran’s main oversight group said that the election had been the “healthiest” since 1979.
articles.abstract: Options continued to shrink for the opposition as Iran’s main oversight group said that the election had been the “healthiest” since 1979.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN  The direct confrontation over Iran’s presidential election was effectively silenced Friday when the main opposition leader said he would seek permits for any future protests, an influential cleric suggested that leaders of the demonstrations could be executed, and the council responsible for validating the election repeated its declaration that there were no major irregularities.
articles.byline: By Nazila Fathi and Michael Slackman

articles.headline: Medication Is a Focus of Jackson Inquiry
articles.snippet: A car belonging to Michael Jackson’s doctor was seized for possible medications or other evidence.
articles.abstract: A car belonging to Michael Jackson’s doctor was seized for possible medications or other evidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Having completed a preliminary autopsy, Los Angeles County medical officials said Friday that Michael Jackson had taken prescription medications but that the cause of his sudden death would not be known for weeks, pending toxicology tests.
